page.title: 18Transport in Oakley
page.content: There are buses to Oxford,Thame and Bicester stopping at two places,outside the shop and at the end of College Crescent.The buses to Bicester and Thame go once a week and buses to Oxford go three times a week.Most families have one or two cars.There is a garage opposite the shop at which people can buy petrol and have their car mended.People use their cars to go to work and to do shopping and any outings they want to make.Other people have motor bikes and mopeds to make these journeys.A coach takes secondary school children to Wheatley each day.Some children are brought into the village to Oakley school by taxi.
